titlestmt.titleproper: Kingsessing Building Association minute book and papers 1873-1922 1873-1883
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Kingsessing Building Association minute book and papers
did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: The Kingsessing Building Association was incorporated on June 12, 1868 in Pennsylvania. Its Constitution states that it "shall have for its object the accumulation of a fund by the saving of the members thereof, sufficient to enable the Stockholders to build or purchase for themselves, respectively, dwelling-houses or other real estate, or to invest in any lawful business that may be deemed most advantageous." Membership in the association was open to both men and women.

scopecontent.p: The volume consists of minutes of monthly meetings describing the selling of shares, election of officers, and the financial outlook for the association. Loose items include several annual reports, the constitution and by-laws of the association, bonds that individuals had with the association, ballots, financial reports, and additional meeting minutes.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Gift of the Moyerman family.
